channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Global markets are all over the place after U.S. stocks slump following Trump’s attacks on Fed chair Powell
item.description: Analysts expressed a high degree of nervousness at the prospect that Powell might be replaced by someone who would give Trump more direct political co...

item.title: U.S. Congressman Backtracks On Social Media Post Claiming He Fired Weapons At Nuclear-Armed Russia
item.description: The post leaves little room for interpretation. It sure looks like a sitting U.S. congressman fired shots into Russia, ratcheting up tensions.

item.title: New Anti-Hegseth Op Illustrates The Media’s Campaign To Protect The Pentagon Status Quo
item.description: If Hegseth's tenure as defense secretary thus far is what 'total chaos' is supposed to look like, then by all means keep it coming.

item.title: Trump issues full-throated endorsement of Sen. Steve Daines: 'HE WILL NOT LET YOU DOWN!'
item.description: President Donald Trump calls Sen. Steve Daines, a Republican from Montana, "a Great Man, and TREMENDOUS Senator," endorsing him in a post on Truth Soc...

item.title: LA lawsuits accuse insurance companies of colluding to ‘suddenly and simultaneously’ drop coverage in fire-prone parts of California
item.description: The lawsuits come as California is struggling with an ongoing insurance crisis, where companies are boosting rates, limiting coverage or pulling out c...

item.title: Georgia Gov. Kemp signs 2 laws aimed at cutting jury awards and limiting when businesses and property owners can be held liable for negligence
item.description: Opponents of the new law note verdicts in the millions of dollars are rare, and those over $10 million represent less than 1% of outcomes.

item.title: Minneapolis DA will not pursue criminal charges against suspected Tesla vandal
item.description: The Minneapolis district attorney will not pursue criminal charges against a Minnesota state employee accused of vandalizing at least six Teslas.

item.title: Judge temporarily blocks NYC Mayor Adams' plan to allow ICE agents in Rikers Island jail complex
item.description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has been ordered to temporarily halt a program to have ICE agents operate in the Rikers Island jail complex.

item.title: Europe’s richest man Bernard Arnault slammed the EU for failing U.S. negotiations—but von der Leyen says countries are ‘lining up to work with us’
item.description: "It will be Brussels' fault" if LVMH produces more of its high-end goods in the U.S., Arnault warned.

item.title: Trump Energy chief recounts evolution of US environs over 55 'Earth Days': ‘A handily energized society works'
item.description: Energy Secretary Chris Wright celebrated the 55th anniversary of Earth Day by contrasting how the environment looked before and after "handily-energiz...

item.title: Los Angeles’s Democrat mayor wants to axe 1,600 employees as city flounders in slumping economy and wildfire damage
item.description: The prospect of chopping hundreds of government jobs comes as the latest unwelcome news for the first-term Democrat, who will stand for reelection nex...

item.title: State of War: How Trump is fighting a 9-front battle
item.description: Donald Trump is engaged in conflicts across the media, universities and the courts as part of an ambitious second-term presidential agenda.

item.title: Dem senator hosts businesses concerned 'enormous uncertainty' of tariffs could kill crucial tourism industry
item.description: Vermont Democrat Sen. Peter Welch speaks to Fox News Digital about a series of meetings he had with dozens of state businesses concerned about tariffs...

item.title: Bukele Dangles Deported Venezuelans in Prisoner Exchange Proposal to Maduro
item.description: On what terms is Bukele holding Venezuelan aliens deported from the United States?

item.title: Pope Francis, R.I.P.
item.description: The College of Cardinals, in choosing a successor, should look to Jesus’s choice of Peter.

item.title: The Failure of Ritalin
item.description: We’ve gone way too far with stimulants and our kids.

item.title: The Pete Hegseth ‘Chaos’ That Wasn’t Then And Isn’t Now
item.description: Two separate pieces attempting to lather up more Pete Hegseth controversy were published on Sunday, another coordinated campaign to take him down.

item.title: 'Evil is being defeated,' Marjorie Taylor Greene says of pope's death
item.description: Following the death of Pope Francis, Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene suggested on Monday that global power dynamics were shifting under divine influence.

item.title: Trump ramps up attacks on Powell while China flexes, markets fall again
item.description: Wall Street markets cratered again Monday as investors reacted to President Trump's decision to dial up attacks on Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome H. ...

item.title: Trump Could Have a Strong Case to Revoke Harvard’s Tax-Exempt Status
item.description: Thanks to a 1983 opinion widely hailed by progressives at the time, the administration could be on solid ground.

item.title: The Left’s Sudden Crusade For ‘Due Process’ Is A Political Smokescreen To Defend Mass Migration
item.description: Democrats' real aim is to preserve the political dividends of mass illegal migration by delegitimizing and undermining the very policies that voters o...

item.title: House asks Justice Department to probe former Gov. Andrew Cuomo for lying to Congress

item.title: Republicans Are Getting Duly Nervous over Trump’s Iran Nuclear Deal
item.description: Even stalwart Trump allies have voiced hostility toward the administration’s diplomatic overtures.

item.description: The Supreme Court will soon hear a decisive case for parents’ rights to opt their children out of explicit sexual content at school. Justices are set ...

item.title: Social Norms Shape Investment Behavior. What Can Advisors Do About It?
item.description: Note to financial advisors: It’s time to embrace the norm effect and rethink how we influence investment decisions.

item.title: Book Review: Quantitative Risk and Portfolio Management: Theory and Practice
item.description: This book fills a unique gap between the CFA curriculum and the growing demand to find model-driven investment management solutions.
